---
title: "Creating Your First Repository on PhEpiGit"
---

You can create a new repository using the command line, RStudio, or GitHub. However, we'll focus on GitHub here because it helps us stick to our reproducible research SOP.

Once you're part of the PhEpiGit, you have write permissions. That means you can clone, pull, and push to all our PhEpiGit repositories.

[To set up a new GitHub repository:]{style="color: #2E6B96; font-weight: bold;"}

1. Go to the upper-right corner of the PhEpiGit and select +, then select **New repository**

![Create a new repository](images/newrepo.svg){#fig-newrepo .absolute top=160 left=380 width="600"}

While GitHub enables repository management tasks, complete control can be achieved using a command line text editor or tools like RStudio. This document underscores utilising RStudio as a central element for effective GitHub repository management.
